fields.description:
An issue named "follow" causes problems with the links.

This issue should serve as POC
fields.summary: follow

fields.description:
For the last week now, this has been happening to my colleagues and I intermittently.

We select 'Merge'\\
The popup to merge comes up.  Select to continue.\\
Loader comes up for a bit\\
Screen reloads and the Pull Request is classified as Declined\\
But if you look at the the commit history, there is commit for the pull request merge.

This has happened to 3 of our users now and we have multiple examples of this in our deployment.  Please let me know what additional info would be helpful to you.
fields.summary: Selecting Merge Pull Request merges the request, but then logs it as Declined (BB-9675)

fields.description:
When making a pull request how about having the option to chose which issue in the issue tracker the pull request pertains to. Then, when that linked up pull request is merged in it could post an update to the issue, or optionally resolve the issue right then.

This could resolve some of the back and forth between issues and pull requests that happen, so that everyone is updated at the same time.
fields.summary: Link Pull Requests to Open Issues (BB-9577)

fields.description:
I have been trying to trace down when/by whom a particular pull request in one of our Bitbucket repos was declined (have a feeling someone "accidentally" hit the button).  In doing so I found that the decline action was not recorded in the "Activity" tab for the pull request.

Going back and looking at other declined pull requests (about a half dozen or so), I found that there are some that clearly have activity items with the red "DECLINED" text and others that also have no indication when/by whom the decline was done.

So it looks like in certain cases Bitbucket is not logging the decline activity.

Please let me know if you need specifics of our repo for further debugging.

thanks
fields.summary: Decline of pull request does not always appear in Activity log

fields.description:
I would like to be able to customize the commit message suggested when I press the merge button for a pull request.

Right now, I see

bq. Merged user/repo into team/repo ([PR#123|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/pull-requests/123])


which isn't very interesting when users always submit their pull requests from the same repository (please see BCLOUD-8209 and BCLOUD-6705 for why we cannot use bookmarks in a single repository on Bitbucket).

The format I need is this

bq. Merge [delivers BCLOUD-123456] ([PR#123|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/pull-requests/123])


where {{#123456}} is an issue ID from our bug tracker. We put the ID into the commit messages and into the pull request title, so it would be cool if Bitbucket could somehow extract that and suggest it here. I'm not sure how to do that in a 100% reliable way, though.
fields.summary: Pull request commit message template (BB-9559)

fields.description:
Hi,

I have a lot of GitHub repos (a few dozen or so), and when visiting https://bitbucket.org/repo/import/github I only see the first 30, but I know I have more.  How can I import the rest?

Thanks.
fields.summary: Not all GitHub repositories shown for import (BB-9587)

fields.description:
After having a look a HackerNews today I saw that BitBucket have this awesome feature that tells its users what's currently hot and popular on the site.

More info here: https://github.com/explore/subscribe

I don't even use github and I'm interested in subscribing to it, could be a great way to discover awesome code.
fields.summary: Bitbucket "Explore" mail (BB-9556)

fields.description:
Bitbucket has had file editing via web interface for quite some time now, but what about removing files and adding new files via web interface, too?

Many of us have iPads (or other tablets) now and use them while commuting or on the road. We could all be much more productive if we got the full set of features (add new files, edit existing files, remove existing files) via web interface.

Your consideration would be very much appreciated.
fields.summary: How about letting us add new files to a repo via web interface? (BB-9558)

fields.description:
I talked to Beanstalk team and they said in order to use their deploy feature with a BitBucket private repo as a submodule I can add their public key as a deployment key to my BB repo.

Their public key can be found at http://pubkey.beanstalkapp.com/beanstalk_rsa.pub\\
Too bad I can’t use it as a deployment key in my BB repository because “Someone has already registered this as an account SSH key.”

Well, I’m pretty sure someone really already registered this key - is a public key, after all. This limitation doesn’t make much sense.
fields.summary: Beanstalk public key is already in use

fields.description: When I create a repo called “Repository name”, it automatically get an url “repository-name”, but I want to use “repository_name” instead. Since I can’t change the repository name and slug independently, there’s no way to do that currently (unless I put the underscore in the name, which looks silly).
fields.summary: Make repository url (slug) user defined (BB-1579)

fields.description:
As evidenced, for example, by the comments on https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/2874/ability-to-search-source-code-bb-39\\
it would be really cool to take comments that are just "+1" or other similarly common comments and

# convert them to a Vote
# purge the comment completely - or at very least don't notify watchers about it.
fields.summary: Convert "+1" comments into votes for the issue instead

fields.description:
Create an option to disable git/mercurial repository (with links like: Overview, Source, Commits etc) sounds strange, but consider this use case:

* Wiki itself a mercurial repository.
* Wiki can be disabled.

So, why not to make "main" repository being able to enable/disable on request?
fields.summary: Disabling the git/mercurial repository

fields.description: it appears i cannot search the entire document while it's open in the online editor.  the text that are not in view from the scrollbar are not taken into account during searching.  am i missing something?
fields.summary: ability to search in online editor (BB-9554)

fields.description:
I have a feature of private repositories that I'm not in agreement with. It concerns the following scenario:

* User A creates a public repository but forces forks to be private
* User B creates a fork (which is of course private)
* User A gets admin rights on the private fork

Fine so far... here's the part that I'm not a "fan" of to put it mildly:

* User B looks at his "Plans and Billing" page and finds that User A counts towards his 5 free users.

That just doesn't seem right to me. Since user B did not explicitly give user A access, your saying this:

* A fork action can lead to a reduction in available users
* If you have a free account, you can only fork max. 5 repos that force private forks.

That seems both unfair as well as illogical. No one should be able to influence how much of my free or paid "private user count" allotment is spent but me.

Case in point: my (forced) private fork here https://bitbucket.org/mvdkleijn/social_login
fields.summary: Forced private forks count towards private user allotment

fields.description: If all of branches have been merged, those merged branches are not accessible from the Branches page on a Mercurial repo.
fields.summary: Merged branches are not accessible from the Branches page if the placeholder merge text is displayed (BB-9598)

fields.description:
Debug hash: f94bfa668a4b4b749b723ef9f8e33485

BTW, as I cannot log in, I cannot get an update on this issue. For this reason I support @blackwc when he/she suggests that anonymous users need a way to tracking their issue status (see Ticket BCLOUD-6014).
fields.summary: Can't login with Google ID

fields.description:
The Renaming of a Repository breaks the "Recent activity" stream.

Fairly easy to reproduce:

* Create a new Repo
* Generate some activity in it so it comes up in the "Recent Activity" panel in the "Overview" page
* Rename the Repo
* Go back to the "Overview" page, note the "Recent Activity" panel now says "Nothing to see here, move along."
fields.summary: Renaming a Repository breaks "Recent activity"

Received error while obtaining access token from https://accounts.google.com/o/oauth2/token: invalid_grant\\
Go to homepage

Funny enough had the exact same error on a project on which I am working on friday.

Google has updated their API's and I had to generate a new api key.

fields.description: On GitHub I am part of two organizations. Notifications from organization A go to my e-mail nowaker@a.com, whereas notifications from B go to nowaker@b.org. Notifications from repositories I contribute to personally go to my private e-mail. I keep things separated from each other. It's not possible to do the same thing in Bitbucket.

fields.description:
I have used BB for some time now to allow the visitors of my Dutch popular-astronomy website by loading the BB issues page in an iframe and displaying a side panel with instructions  for the English fields in the BB page.  I use this work-around since Dutch translations are not yet activated (I twice offered to help translate BB into Dutch on Transifex half a year ago, but never got any reply, so I suppose the translation is done).

Could you please activate the Dutch translation of BB so that I can send my visitors to your page directly?  Alternatively, could you stop blocking the work-around (at least for my website http://hemel.waarnemen.com) until this is done?
fields.summary: Bitbucket issues no longer works in iframe

Looking around seems to indicate this is a common problem.  And the only solution would be to create an issue and let the site admins fix it manually.  It would be more convenient if there's a way to automatically detect and fix these issues.

fields.description:
It would be handy if the wiki for a repo could be set to notify HipChat like any other repo. If there's a way to do this, I'm having a hell of a time finding it.

The HipChat Bitbucket Connector gives an error if I specifically try to target a wiki, but targeting the wiki's parent repo doesn't post wiki updates.

I can't find anywhere to add a hook to the wiki repo, either.

This would be extremely useful for my team's workflow because we use a Bitbucket wiki for our internal process documentation.

fields.description:
See also issue BCLOUD-6520.  The 2.0 api urls started 404ing in the past 24 hours.

For example:

https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/atlassian/atlassian-rest/changesets/a42619c4d8baf9e526c6b85ace84d87fda9603dd/approvals

and

https://bitbucket.org/api/2.0/repositories/atlassian/atlassian-rest/changesets/a42619c4d8baf9e526c6b85ace84d87fda9603dd/likes

Although the 1.0 api still works get get the changeset info:

https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/repositories/atlassian/atlassian-rest/changesets/a42619c4d8baf9e526c6b85ace84d87fda9603dd

The [docs|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/changesets%2BResource#changesetsResource-GETtheapprovalsonanindividualchangesetGreen2.0] suggest that this API endpoint is still valid.
fields.summary: Likes/Approvals REST api returning 404s (again)

fields.description:
The attached image shows timing indications in the "Recent Activity" Overview of a Repository which don't make sense that way.

It says:

* 59 minutes from now
* 51 minutes from now
* 7 minutes from now
* 3 hours ago

but it should be (almost sure, at least the last commit, which is marked as "59 minutes ago" was really +- 1 minute ago):

* *1* minutes ago
* *9* minutes ago
* *53* minutes ago
* 3 hours ago
fields.summary: Time indications (x minutes from now) are wrong

fields.description:
Hi,

We believe we're seeing comments on pull requests being marked as "outdated" when the file/hunk in question hasn't changed. An example is [this pull request|https://bitbucket.org/dealini/dealini/pull-request/139] (this is a private repo, but I hope you can take a peek anyway).

The pull request has two commits and was created yesterday. Today I made several comments in the combined diff view. These comments are now marked with "outdated" even though no new commits were added to the pull request.

The files in question _have_ changed in the main repository, though. I'm not sure if that is the problem, but I had expected that updating the file in the main repository wouldn't invalidate my comments on the pull request.
fields.summary: Comments in pull request outdated without change (BB-9542)

fields.description:
Our organization pays for your [excellent] service.

The way we want to collaborate is by having our employees fork the organization's private repository and then submit pull requests back.  This allows us to use the pull request as a gateway for code review, and we really like it.  It also allows us to better control our "truth" repository (limited access to master/dev branches, no dangling rotting feature branches, etc).   (this is no different from the standard open-source method for collaboration)

The problem is that our employees' private forks have a collaborator limit capped at 5.  If we're paying for the service, our employees shouldn't have to pay to collaborate with their teammates, even though it _happens to be_ in their account.

We thought we might work around this by creating repositories named <REPO>-<username> for each teammate, but then we couldn't figure out how to submit pull requests because they weren't true forks.

If possible, we wanted to avoid employees working out of the truth repo day-to-day.  And they shouldn't have to pay money -- because we did.

What do we do?
fields.summary: Collaborator limit should not be imposed against forks of paid repositories

fields.description: I have my personal account associated to 2 companies. When I commit code to one of the companys, it's actually showing the other companies name where I do commits. I think this is a bug, it should use my account name in either case, not one of the companies I am associated to. This kind of ruins multi-company association ability!
fields.summary: Wrong commiter info shown for those associated to multiple companies.

fields.description:
I have work on the bitbucket api and bitbucket OAuth.\\
I don't have problem with "GET", "POST" and "DELETE", But on the *PUT* requests server return error. Also The restbrowser without problem send the *PUT* requests .

*Error Code: 500* -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------\\
*Error Message: 'dict' object has no attribute '_mutable'* ------------------------------\\
*Error Details :* ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

{code}
#!python

File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/current/bitbucket/local/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/piston/resource.py", line 198, in __call__ result = checked_meth(request, *args, **kwargs) File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/current/bitbucket/local/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/piston/resource.py", line 185, in checked_meth return meth(*args, **kwargs) File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/current/bitbucket/local/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/newrelic-2.5.0.94/newrelic/hooks/component_piston.py", line 33, in __call__ return self._nr_wrapped(*args, **kwargs) File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/2013-07-25/bitbucket/../bitbucket/apps/api/v10/decorators.py", line 334, in wrapper return func(*args, **kwargs) File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/2013-07-25/bitbucket/../bitbucket/apps/bb/decorators.py", line 38, in wrap return f(request, *a, **kwa) File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/2013-07-25/bitbucket/../bitbucket/apps/bb/decorators.py", line 374, in wrapped_function return func(*args, **kwargs) File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/2013-07-25/bitbucket/../bitbucket/apps/api/v10/decorators.py", line 75, in wrapped_function return func(*args, **kwargs) File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/2013-07-25/bitbucket/../bitbucket/apps/api/v10/handlers.py", line 2031, in update form.merge_from_initial() File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/current/bitbucket/local/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/piston/forms.py", line 18, in merge_from_initial self.data._mutable = True

I send requests with wp_remote_request function.
fields.summary: Bitbucket server return "'dict' object has no attribute '_mutable'" message on the PUT requests.

fields.description:
Part of my project generates commits using a database comparison script. Accepting these requires:

# Browse commits.
# Open each commit in a new tab.
# Wait for the page to load (this can take a few seconds).
# Click *Approve*.
# Wait for the commit to be approved (this also takes a few seconds).
# Close the tab.

This is arduous when a large number of incremental database changes have been made.

I would like to request the following feature:

# Browse commits.
# Display only unaccepted commits.
# Check all unaccepted commits with a single click.
# Click *Approve* to approve all checked commits.
fields.summary: Feature request: Approve All Commits

fields.description:
Using the web interface to fork an existing repository to a private copy, other users receive notices containing the name of the new repository.

In my case, I forked from the team lindenlab/viewer-release to a repo in another hidden team account.  Users not in either team received notices containing the name of the hidden team and the newly created hidden repository.  Since they could not see either the team in which the repository was created, nor the resulting repo, they should not have received any notice.
fields.summary: "follow" leaks repository information when creating private repo

fields.description:
The repositories API reports that a repository has an issue tracker even if the tracker is private and it's an unauthenticated party making the request. Same goes for the wiki.

Example: https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/repositories/ZeroOne3010/simple-rss-parser says *"has_issues": true*, whereas you cannot see the issue tracker when looking at the corresponding web page: https://bitbucket.org/ZeroOne3010/simple-rss-parser

I would expect the API to report that no issue tracker or wiki is present unless the requested actually has an access to them. It even says in the issue tracker and wiki settings, under the 'Private' option, that they are "visible only to people who have repository access".
fields.summary: API leaks information about private wiki and issue tracker (BB-9521)

Thanks

My attached screenshot shows my email view in Postbox at half the screen size of a 27" iMac. I'm sure in wider instances, only having the repo name in the title works fine, but it'd be nice to see it in the details of the email as well.

fields.description:
Received the following error message when trying to merge a pull request (see attached screenshot):

{code}
#!
Unable to merge
An error occurred saving this pull request


{code}

story:

* two repositories exist: Parent and Child (cloned from Parent)
* pull request created by Child repository
* go to Parent repository
* attempt to merge pull request
* RESULT: process for about 5 minutes then receive error message stated above
* EXPECTED: merge completes and no errors

notes:

* pull request contains two commits that were stripped from the child repository
* may be related to BCLOUD-8283
fields.summary: "Unable to merge" error when trying to merge a pull request

fields.description:
If you're logged in as a team account, and you attempt to transfer a repository to another team account, no one will receive the transfer notification. This is because users aren't meant to be logged in to the team account.

To workaround this, ensure both teams have an Administrator. Then, while logged in as a team administrator, transfer the repository to the other team. All notifications should be sent.
fields.summary: Transferring from team account to team account won't work. (BB-9510)
Markdown viewer doesn't support next level lists
Fix references to ${SSH_ENV} in Git SSH setup documentation

The online editor would be a lot more useful if it wrapped the text for documentation files.  I went to make a change to a markdown file and gave because of the lack of wrapping.  I know CodeMirror has the option lineWrapping.  Could this be exposed as a checkbox or default to enabled for commonly wrapped file type (like markdown or plain text).

Thanks,\\
Brandon
fields.summary: Add an option to wrap text in online editor (BB-9501)

fields.description:
Note: this is related to Issue BCLOUD-4954.

When you decline a pull request there should be a confirmation dialog asking if you really do want to decline if one or more reviewers have already approved the PR.

I'm new enough to BB that I haven't had the situation arise yet where I've needed to decline a PR, so if there is already such a dialog, this feature request then becomes to add a prominent warning to the dialog that one or more reviewers have approved the PR.
fields.summary: Warn of reviewer approval when declining a pull request (BB-9511)

fields.description:
Someone in our organization declined a pull request, but we cannot see who did it. The activity tab does not mention the event.

If you have such data logged and decide to add this feature, could you back-create activities so that they are visible on old declines as well?
fields.summary: Save Message in Activity Log for Decline Action

fields.description:
The pull-request id is only included in {{pullrequest_created}}.

* pullrequest_declined
* pullrequest_unapprove
* pullrequest_merged
* pullrequest_updated

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Pull+Request+POST+hook+management
fields.summary: Pull Request POST hook does not include links to related objects (BB-9535)

fields.description:
My team use bitbucket extensively but, as an admin, I find that I get a lot of traffic from bitbucket and it's hard to pick out the messages that I really care about with filter rules in my email client.  I'd like to be able to distinguish the following traffic:

* pull request traffic for pull requests that I initiated
* important messages such as "approved" or "declined"
* "new pull request" messages where I'm one of the reviewers or where I'm added as a reviewer to an existing pull request
* subsequent traffic for pull requests for which I'm a reviewer
* pull request traffic for pull requests that I'm not a reviewer (I want to file these for occasional review rather than have them drop into my inbox)

The big problem I have right now is I can't filter the messages because each individual message doesn't seem to have the relevant context in it.  For example, a comment on a pull request has the name of the pull request in it but it doesn't have a line saying "this is your pull request" or "you are a reviewer on this pull request" for me to filter on.
fields.summary: Finer-grained, easier-to-filter email notifications (BB-9467)
